intro: Thelymitra merraniae, commonly known as the Merran's rock orchid, is an endemic species native to the southern regions of Western Australia. It is a terrestrial orchid characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, often pale green or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its flowers are usually small and arranged in a loose spike, with three sepals and three petals, typical of the Orchidaceae family. Thelymitra merraniae is a rare and critically endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its natural habitat.
